snippet: The company, which also owns Kmart, announced a loss of $548 million for its third quarter, though sales figures improved.
abstract: Sears Holdings reports that its third-quarter loss widened from the same period year ago and discloses that it plans to close 235 stores; says its short-term debt increased to $2.1 billion in third quarter, up from $1.8 billion in year-ago period.
lead_paragraph: The company, which also owns Kmart, announced a loss of $548 million for its third quarter, though sales figures improved.

headline.main: Sears Loss Widens as It Strives for Rebound
headline.print_headline: Sears Loss Widens as It Strives for Rebound
